_header: Gabriel of high degree / Came down from the Trinity
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 455.
Subjects: carols, of the Annunciation; Virgin Mary, Annunciation to
_description: Annunciation carol — seven 4-line stanzas (aaab) including refrain, ‘With noua’, plus burden (bb): ‘Nova Nova / Ave fit ex Eva’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines:
Gabryell of hyȝe degreeCam down from þe
                    trenyte…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines: …& godes mayd now se me herewith noua

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Gabriell of hygh degreHe cam down from the
                    trynyte…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…I am godes own trulyEcce ancilla dominivt
                    novaExplicit

GULHun83.First Lines:
Gabriell off hye degreHe came downe frome
                    trinite…
GULHun83.Last Lines:
…I am your seruaunt ryȝt truelyWith
ecce ancilla domini
GULHun83.Note:
Six 3-line stanzas, monorhyming, plus burden, ‘Noua noua Aue fit
                    ex Eua’.
